translated: Sutra of the Names of the Thousand Buddhas of the Past Adorned Eon, also called Gathering the Great Merits of All Buddhas
The name of the translator is lost, now attached to the Liang Catalog
If there are good men and good women who hear the names of the Buddhas of the three times and three eons,

rejoice in faith and joy, uphold, chant, read and recite them without slander, or are able to write them out and explain them to others, or are able to paint and create Buddha images, or are able to make offerings of incense, flowers, music, and praise the merits of the Buddha with utmost sincerity, their merit surpasses that of using the treasures filling the worlds of the ten directions, pure maá¹‡i jewels piled up to the Brahma Heaven, and giving them away for a hundred thousand eons.

These good men and good women, having already made offerings to these Buddhas, will in their subsequent lives serve the Buddhas in succession until they become Buddhas themselves, without end. They will all receive predictions from the Buddhas of the three times and three eons, and wherever they are born, they will always encounter the Three Jewels, be born in the Buddha lands, have complete six senses, not fall into the eight difficulties, and attain the thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks of the Buddhas, fully adorned.
If they can prostrate with their five limbs to the ground and declare with their own mouths:

I now make universal obeisance to all the Buddhas of the ten directions, three times, and all the three periods of time, wishing that the three evil paths may be at peace, that the country may be prosperous and the people at ease, that the heterodox views may turn towards the right path, and that they may give rise to the bodhi mind;

Upholding this merit, I wish to be born together with all sentient beings of the six realms in the land of AmitÄyus Buddha, make great vows, and cause all sentient beings to be born in that land, with the excellent physical characteristics, wisdom, and eloquence like AmitÄbha Buddha, and attain the majestic and lofty fruits and longevity.

Homage to the Buddha of Compassionate Respect, Homage to the Buddha of Peaceful Loving Respect.

Disciples, from beginningless time until today, with this mind and consciousness, always harboring vicious thoughts and lacking a compassionate mind, sometimes killing out of greed, sometimes killing out of anger, ignorance, and arrogance;

sometimes devising evil means, vowing to kill, wishing to kill, and killing through spells, sometimes breaking through lakes and ponds, burning mountains and fields, hunting and fishing, sometimes setting fires with the wind, flying kites and chasing dogs, killing everything, such sins as these I now repent of all.

Or using fences, traps, pits, and snares, spears, halberds, bows and crossbows, to shoot flying birds and running beasts, or using nets, traps, and hooks, to catch aquatic creatures such as fish, turtles, alligators, shrimp, clams, and snails, causing those that live in water, on land, and in the air to have no place to hide;
Or raising chickens, pigs, cows, sheep, geese, and ducks to supply one's own kitchen;

Or selling them to be slaughtered, causing their mournful cries to cease, their feathers and fur to fall off, their scales and shells to be damaged, their heads and bodies to be separated, their bones and flesh to be crushed, their skin to be flayed, their meat to be cut up, their bodies to be roasted, boiled, and grilled, their suffering to be inflicted unjustly, just for a moment's pleasure.

The mouth obtains very few flavors, no more than the tip of the tongue, yet the retribution for its sins and calamities bind one for eternal kalpas. Such sins are today all repented of with utmost sincerity.

Furthermore, from beginningless time until today, we have either raised armies to attack each other, fought battles, faced each other in two opposing armies, and killed each other, or we have killed ourselves, taught others to kill, or rejoiced upon hearing of killing;
We have engaged in butchering, fishing, and execution, slaughtering the lives of others, and acting without compassion;
We have indulged in anger, brandishing weapons and dancing with blades;

We have beheaded, stabbed, pushed into pits and trenches, drowned in water, blocked caves and destroyed nests with earth and stones, or trampled all beings with carts and horses, like this, the offenses are immeasurable and boundless, today we confess and repent of them all.

Furthermore, from beginningless time, we have either aborted fetuses or broken eggs, used poisonous drugs or sorcery to harm and kill sentient beings, tilled the soil and dug the ground, planted fields and gardens, raised silkworms and boiled cocoons, harming and killing insects in the process;
Killing is very severe, sometimes hitting mosquitoes and flies, pinching lice and fleas, or burning to remove rubbish
, opening and closing ditches and canals, unjustly harming all, sometimes eating fruits or using grains
, sometimes water or vegetables, killing living beings indiscriminately, sometimes burning firewood or exposing lamps and candles
, burning various insects, sometimes eating sauces and vinegar, not looking at the movement, sometimes pouring boiling water
, drowning insects and ants, in this way, up to the four deportments of walking, standing, sitting, and lying down
, always injuring and killing the subtle living beings in the air and on the ground.
Disciples, with the ignorance of ordinary beings, not aware or knowing, today we confess and repent all of it.

Moreover, disciples, from beginningless time until today, we have used whips, sticks, shackles, chains, cangues, fetters, torture, beating, kicking with hands and feet, binding, caging, and cutting off food and drink. In this way, we have used various evil means to torment sentient beings. Today, with utmost sincerity, we repent before the Buddhas of the ten directions, the honored Dharma, and the noble Sangha, confessing all.

We wish that by the merit generated from repenting of the offenses of killing and so forth, in life after life, we may attain the vajra body with an infinite lifespan, forever free from enmity, without thoughts of killing or harming.

Toward all sentient beings, they attain the state of regarding them as their only child. If they see those in danger and distress, they do not spare their own lives, but skillfully rescue and liberate them. Only then do they expound the subtle and correct Dharma, causing all sentient beings who see their form or shadow to all attain peace and happiness. Hearing their name or voice, all fears are eliminated. Each pays homage once.

The disciples, from beginningless time until today, have either stolen others' wealth and treasures, wielding weapons to forcefully take them, or relying on their own power and status to oppress and take them, or relying on the power of public authority to falsely accuse good and righteous people with high stakes and large shackles, swallowing bribes and taking straight as crooked. For these causes and conditions, their bodies are entangled in the legal net.

Or, serving as an unjust ruler, they take others' wealth and property, encroaching on public goods for private gain and private goods for public gain, harming others to benefit themselves, and benefiting others to harm themselves, cutting others to enrich themselves, giving with their mouths while being stingy in their hearts.
Or secretly evading taxes and duties, smuggling across customs, concealing public taxes and levies, hiding from service.
Such offenses, we now repent of them all.
Either taking what is not given of the property of the Buddha, Dharma, or Sangha, or the property of scriptures and images, or the property of repairing
pagodas and temples, or the property of offerings to the resident monks, or the property of the Sangha of the four directions,
or stealing, misappropriating, or not returning due to influence, or borrowing for oneself or lending to others, or exchanging and lending
with negligence, or mixing and using the property of the Three Jewels in confusion, or using the property of the assembly such as grain, rice, firewood,
salt, vinegar, vegetables, fruits, money, silk, bamboo,
silk, banners, flowers, incense, oil, and candles according to one's whims, or using them oneself,

or giving them to others, or plucking flowers of the Buddha, using the property of the Sangha's adornments, or privately benefiting oneself through the wealth of the Three Jewels, such offenses are immeasurable and boundless, we now repent of them all with shame and remorse.

The nine hundred Buddhas of the past.
After paying homage to the Three Jewels, he then repents again.
Having already repented the retribution of the hells, he should next repent the retribution of the three evil paths.
The Buddha said in the sutra:
Those with much desire, because they seek many benefits, also have much suffering and distress.
A contented person, even if sleeping on the ground, still considers it happiness;
An uncontented person, even if dwelling in heaven, still finds it unsatisfactory.
But worldly people, when suddenly faced with an emergency, are able to give away wealth, regardless of the amount;
Yet they do not know that this body is on the brink of the deep pit of the three evil paths, and with one breath not returned, it should fall into it.
If there are knowledgeable people who arrange meritorious deeds and have them cultivate future wholesome Dharma provisions, they hold on to this stingy mind and are unwilling to do anything about it.
Such people are extremely foolish and deluded.
Why is this so?
The Buddha said in the sÅ«tras:

When born, one does not bring even a single coin, and when dying, one does not take even a single coin. Exhausting oneself in accumulating wealth brings worry and distress, and it is of no benefit to oneself, but in vain for others.
Without any wholesome deeds to rely on and no virtues to trust in, one will be sent to the end of one's life and fall into the evil paths.
Therefore, disciples, today we bow our heads and sincerely take refuge in the Buddha.

Disciples, today we next repent of the karmic retribution of not recognizing anything in the animal realm.ğŸ”½We repent of the karmic retribution of bearing heavy burdens and plowing in the animal realm, repaying others' past debts.
We repent of the karmic retribution of not being free in the animal realm, being cut and slaughtered by others.
We repent of the karmic retribution of having no feet, two feet, four feet, or many feet in the animal realm.
We repent of the karmic retribution of being eaten by small insects in the fur, feathers, scales, and shells of animals in the animal realm.
Thus, in the animal realm, there are immeasurable karmic retributions, which we sincerely repent of today.
Next, we repent of the karmic retribution of long hunger in the hungry ghost realm.
We repent of the karmic retribution of hungry ghosts not hearing the names of drink and food for hundreds of thousands of years.
Repent of the karmic retribution of hungry ghosts who eat pus, blood, and filth.ğŸ”½Repent of the karmic retribution of hungry ghosts whose limbs and joints burn when they move.
Repent of the karmic retribution of hungry ghosts with large bellies and small throats.
In this way, in the realm of hungry ghosts, there are immeasurable sufferings and karmic retributions. Today, we bow our heads and repent of them all.
Next, we repent of the karmic retributions of all ghosts and spirits in the asura realm, such as flattery, deception, and false claims.
Repent of the karmic retribution of carrying sand and stones as ghosts and spirits, filling rivers and seas.
Repent of the ugly karmic retribution of rÄká¹£asas, kumbhÄá¹‡á¸as, and other evil ghosts and spirits who are born to eat blood and flesh.

In this way, in the realm of ghosts and spirits, there are immeasurable and boundless karmic retributions. Today, we bow our heads and repent before the buddhas of the ten directions and the great bodhisattvas, seeking their compassion to eradicate them all.

May the disciples, by the merit generated from repenting of the karmic retributions of the animal realm and so forth, in life after life, extinguish the defilements of ignorance, recognize their own karmic causes, illuminate with wisdom, and sever the bodies of the evil destinies.

May the merit generated from repenting of the karmic retributions of the hungry ghosts and so forth, in life after life, forever part from the suffering of stinginess, greed, and hunger, and always savor the sweet nectar of liberation.

May the merit generated from repenting of the karmic retributions of ghosts, asuras, and so forth, in life after life, be honest and without flattery, part from the causes of wrong livelihood, eliminate the fruits of ugliness, and bring blessings and benefits to humans and gods.

May the disciples from now until reaching the Way-place, definitely not receive the retributions of the four evil destinies, except for the great compassion for sentient beings, by the power of vows, abiding in them without weariness. (One prostration.)
South, West, North, East, South-East, South-West, West-North, North-East, Below, Above.
